meanings.sent1: After opening the bag of chips, make sure to reseal it to keep them fresh.
meanings.sent2: I always reseal the envelope after reading the letter inside.
meanings.sent3: He tried to reseal the cookie jar, but the lid wouldn't fit back on properly.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to reseal the bond between them, making everything right again.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was to reseal the torn paper back into one piece.

meanings.sent1: Please reseal the bottle of juice before putting it back in the fridge.
meanings.sent2: The hiker made sure to reseal the water bottle tightly to prevent leaks.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to reseal the nut container, thinking there were more treats inside.
meanings.sent4: The team's victory helped reseal their reputation as champions.
meanings.sent5: The glue was so strong, it could reseal the broken vase as good as new.

meanings.definition: To seal (a container) again after it has been opened.
meanings.sent1: Don't forget to reseal the jam jar after making your sandwich.
meanings.sent2: She had to reseal the paint can to prevent it from drying out.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to reseal the treat box, hoping for more snacks to magically appear.
meanings.sent4: His apology helped reseal the crack in their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's quick action was able to reseal the breach in the dam, saving the town from flooding.
